question.text: Acid rain is caused because of

options.text: excess <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> released from burning of fossil fuels
excess production of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>    by industry and coal gas
excess release of carbon monoxide by incomplete combustion in industries.
excess formation of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  by combustion and animal respiration.

solution.text: In acid rain, pH of rain water is less than <math><mn>5</mn></math>. Acid rain is caused by large scale emission of acidic gases into the atmosphere from thermal power plants, industries and automobiles. The common ones are sulphur dioxide, nitrogen oxides (NO<sub>X</sub>). Sulphur dioxide and nitrogen oxides are changed in the atmosphere into sulphuric acid and nitric acid by combining with oxygen and water, which then fall on earth in the form of acid rain.
